summary.span: 這個類別是抽象的。

span.span: This class is abstract.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是抽象基底類別和，這將字元寫入到資料流和字串，分別。 is the abstract base class of and , which write characters to streams and strings, respectively. 建立的執行個體寫入字串的物件，將字串寫入至檔案，或將 XML 序列化。Create an instance of to write an object to a string, write strings to a file, or to serialize XML. 您也可以使用的執行個體以將文字寫入至自訂的備份存放區使用相同的 Api，您會使用字串或資料流，或是將文字格式的支援。You can also use an instance of to write text to a custom backing store using the same APIs you would use for a string or a stream, or to add support for text formatting. 所有`Write`方法具有基本資料型別，如參數寫出做為字串值。All the `Write` methods of having primitive data types as parameters write out the values as strings. 根據預設，不是安全執行緒。By default, a is not thread safe. 請參閱安全執行緒的包裝函式。See for a thread-safe wrapper. > [!IMPORTANT] > 此類型會實作介面。This type implements the interface. 當您完成使用衍生自這個型別的任何類型時，您應該會處置它直接或間接。When you have finished using any type that derives from this type, you should dispose of it either directly or indirectly. 若要直接處置的類型，呼叫其方法中的`try` / `catch`區塊。To dispose of the type directly, call its method in a `try`/`catch` block. 若要為其配置間接，使用語言建構例如`using`（C# 中） 或`Using`（在 Visual Basic)。To dispose of it indirectly, use a language construct such as `using` (in C#) or `Using` (in Visual Basic). 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 Dispose 和中的 「 使用物件的實作 IDisposable 」 一節介面 > 主題。For more information, see Dispose and the "Using an Object that Implements IDisposable" section in the interface topic. 如需的一般 I/O 工作清單，請參閱[一般 I/O 工作](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 類別是抽象類別。The class is an abstract class. 因此，您的程式碼中不必將它執行個體化。Therefore, you do not instantiate it in your code. 類別衍生自，並提供成員的實作寫入資料流。The class derives from and provides implementations of the members for writing to a stream. 下列範例示範如何撰寫使用包含字串值，以文字檔案的兩個線條方法。The following example shows how to write two lines that consist of string values to a text file by using the method. 提供衍生類別中覆寫 DisposeOverride Dispose in a derived class to provide [!code-csharp[System.IO.StreamWriter#23](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.StreamWriter/CS/example23.cs#23)] [!code-vb[System.IO.StreamWriter#23](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.StreamWriter/VB/example23.vb#23)]

summary.span: 關閉目前寫入器並釋放任何與寫入器相關聯的系統資源。

span.span: Closes the current writer and releases any system resources associated with the writer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這項實作`Close`呼叫方法並將其傳遞`true`值。This implementation of `Close` calls the method and passes it a `true` value. 清除資料流不會清除其基礎的編碼器，除非您明確地呼叫或`Close`。Flushing the stream will not flush its underlying encoder unless you explicitly call or `Close`. 設定屬性`true`表示從緩衝區資料流，清除資料，但並不會清除編碼器狀態。Setting the property to `true` means that data will be flushed from the buffer to the stream, but the encoder state will not be flushed. 這可讓編碼器將保存其狀態 （部分字元），讓它可以正確編碼字元的下一個區塊。This allows the encoder to keep its state (partial characters) so that it can encode the next block of characters correctly. 這種情況下會影響 UTF8 及 UTF7 其中編碼某些字元才編碼器接收或多個相鄰的字元。This scenario affects UTF8 and UTF7 where certain characters can be encoded only after the encoder receives the adjacent character or characters. > [!NOTE] > 在衍生類別中，不會覆寫方法。In derived classes, do not override the method. 相反地，覆寫方法，將程式碼，以便釋放資源。Instead, override the method to add code for releasing resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用完畢時，請呼叫 。Call when you are finished using the . 方法會將 保留在無法使用的狀態。The method leaves the in an unusable state. 在呼叫，您必須釋放所有參考讓記憶體回收行程可以回收記憶體的所佔用。After calling , you must release all references to the so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the was occupying. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱[清除 Unmanaged 資源上](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)和[實作 Dispose 方法](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md). **請注意**永遠呼叫您釋放最後一個參考之前。**Note** Always call before you release your last reference to the . 否則工作窗格所使用的資源不會釋放，直到記憶體回收行程呼叫 物件的 方法。Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the object's method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個屬性是必要的標頭必須寫入其中所包含的編碼方式使用某些 XML 案例`TextWriter`。This property is necessary for some XML scenarios where a header must be written containing the encoding used by the `TextWriter`. 這可讓取用任意的 XML 程式碼`TextWriter`並產生正確的 XML 標頭。This enables the XML code to consume an arbitrary `TextWriter` and generate the correct XML header. 如需的一般 I/O 工作清單，請參閱[一般 I/O 工作](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md).

summary.span: 清除目前寫入器的所有緩衝區，並造成任何緩衝資料都寫入基礎裝置。

span.span: Clears all buffers for the current writer and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個預設方法沒有作用，但在衍生的類別可以覆寫方法以提供適當的功能。This default method does nothing, but derived classes can override the method to provide the appropriate functionality. 清除資料流不會清除其基礎的編碼器，除非您明確地呼叫`Flush`或。Flushing the stream will not flush its underlying encoder unless you explicitly call `Flush` or . 設定至`true`表示從緩衝區資料流，清除資料，但並不會清除編碼器狀態。Setting to `true` means that data will be flushed from the buffer to the stream, but the encoder state will not be flushed. 這可讓編碼器將保存其狀態 （部分字元），讓它可以正確編碼字元的下一個區塊。This allows the encoder to keep its state (partial characters) so that it can encode the next block of characters correctly. 這種情況下會影響 UTF8 及 UTF7 其中某些字元可以只編碼的編碼器接收或多個相鄰的字元之後。This scenario affects UTF8 and UTF7 where certain characters can only be encoded after the encoder receives the adjacent character or characters.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 值屬性會指定可在您呼叫的特定文化特性的格式設定和方法。The value of the property specifies the culture-specific formatting that is used when you call the and methods. 如果您不想要提供的格式提供者，您會建立執行個體使用建構函式，設定屬性`null`。If you do not want to provide a format provider, you create an instance by using the constructor, which sets the property to `null`. 當屬性包含`null`，目前執行緒的文化特性進行格式化。When the property contains `null`, the culture of the current thread is used for formatting. 如需建立檔案，並將文字寫入至檔案的範例，請參閱[How to： 將文字寫入至檔案](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-write-text-to-a-file.md)。For an example of creating a file and writing text to a file, see [How to: Write Text to a File](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-write-text-to-a-file.md). 從檔案讀取文字的範例，請參閱[How to： 從檔案讀取文字](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-read-text-from-a-file.md)。For an example of reading text from a file, see [How to: Read Text from a File](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-read-text-from-a-file.md). 如需讀取和寫入二進位檔案的範例，請參閱[如何： 讀取和寫入至新建立資料檔](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-read-and-write-to-a-newly-created-data-file.md)。For an example of reading from and writing to a binary file, see [How to: Read and Write to a Newly Created Data File](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-read-and-write-to-a-newly-created-data-file.md). 如需的一般 I/O 工作清單，請參閱[一般 I/O 工作](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md).

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Write(string format, object arg0) cil managed
Public Overridable Sub Write (format As String, arg0 As Object)
public: virtual void Write(System::String ^ format, System::Object ^ arg0);

param.name: format
param.span: 複合格式字串。

span.span: A composite format string.

param.name: arg0
param.span: 要格式化及寫入的物件。

span.span: The object to format and write.

summary.span: 使用與 方法相同的語意，將格式化字串寫入到文字字串或資料流。

span.span: Writes a formatted string to the text string or stream, using the same semantics as the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法會使用複合格式化物件的值轉換為其字串表示，以及該表示嵌入字串。This method uses composite formatting to convert the value of an object to its string representation and to embed that representation in a string. .NET 提供廣泛的格式化支援，下列格式的主題中的更詳細地說明：.NET provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 如需有關複合格式功能的詳細資訊，請參閱[複合格式化](~/docs/standard/base-types/composite-formatting.md)。For more information about the composite formatting feature, see [Composite Formatting](~/docs/standard/base-types/composite-formatting.md). - 如需有關數值格式規範的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自訂數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 如需有關日期和時間格式規範的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)和[自訂日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md)。For more information about date and time format specifiers, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md) and [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md). - 如需列舉格式規範的詳細資訊，請參閱[列舉格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/enumeration-format-strings.md)。For more information about enumeration format specifiers, see [Enumeration Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/enumeration-format-strings.md). - 如需格式的詳細資訊，請參閱[格式化型別](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about formatting, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). `format`參數是由零個或多個文字執行混合零或多個索引的預留位置，稱為對應格式項目，這個方法的參數清單中的物件。The `format` parameter consists of zero or more runs of text intermixed with zero or more indexed placeholders, called format items, that correspond to an object in the parameter list of this method. 格式化的程序會將每個格式項目取代對應之物件的值的字串表示。The formatting process replaces each format item with the string representation of the value of the corresponding object. 格式項目的語法如下所示：The syntax of a format item is as follows: {*index*[,*length*][:*formatString*]}{*index*[,*length*][:*formatString*]} 方括號中的項目是選擇性的。Elements in square brackets are optional. 下表描述每個項目。The following table describes each element. 如需有關複合格式功能，包括語法的格式項目，請參閱[複合格式化](~/docs/standard/base-types/composite-formatting.md)。For more information about the composite formatting feature, including the syntax of a format item, see [Composite Formatting](~/docs/standard/base-types/composite-formatting.md). |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |索引index|參數清單中要格式化之物件的以零為起始位置。The zero-based position in the parameter list of the object to be formatted. 如果所指定的物件*索引*是`null`，格式項目都會取代。If the object specified by *index* is `null`, the format item is replaced by . 因為這個多載具有單一物件，其參數中列出，值*索引*必須一律為 0。Because this overload has only a single object in its parameter list, the value of *index* must always be 0. 如果在沒有參數*索引*位置就會擲回。If there is no parameter in the *index* position, a is thrown.| |*長度*,*length*|在參數的字串表示的字元數目下限。The minimum number of characters in the string representation of the parameter. 如果是正數，參數是靠右對齊。如果是負數，它是靠左對齊。If positive, the parameter is right-aligned; if negative, it is left-aligned.| |:*formatString*:*formatString*|標準或自訂格式字串格式化的物件所支援。A standard or custom format string that is supported by the object to be formatted. 可能值*formatString*支援的物件的值相同`ToString(string format)`方法。Possible values for *formatString* are the same as the values supported by the object's `ToString(string format)` method. 如果*formatString*未指定，並要格式化的物件會實作介面，`null`傳遞的值為`format`參數做為格式字串。If *formatString* is not specified and the object to be formatted implements the interface, `null` is passed as the value of the `format` parameter that is used as the format string.| 前置和尾端大括號字元，"{"和"}"，所需。The leading and trailing brace characters, "{" and "}", are required. 若要指定在單一常值的大括號字元`format`、 指定兩個前置或尾端大括號字元; 也就是"{{"或"}}"。To specify a single literal brace character in `format`, specify two leading or trailing brace characters; that is, "{{" or "}}". 。. 這個方法不會在指定的字串中搜尋個別的新行字元 (十六進位的 0x000a)，也不會以 取代它們。This method does not search the specified string for individual newline characters (hexadecimal 0x000a) and replace them with . 如果格式字串中不會參考指定的物件，則會忽略它。If a specified object is not referenced in the format string, it is ignored. 如需的一般 I/O 工作清單，請參閱[一般 I/O 工作](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md).

span.span: is .
The is closed.
An I/O error occurs.

exception.span: 不是有效的複合格式字串。

span.span: is not a valid composite format string.
-or-

exception.span: 格式項目的索引小於 0 (零)，或大於或等於要格式化的物件數目 (就這個方法多載而言，是一個)。

span.span: The index of a format item is less than 0 (zero), or greater than or equal to the number of objects to be formatted (which, for this method overload, is one).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法會使用複合格式化物件的值轉換為其字串表示，以及該表示嵌入字串。This method uses composite formatting to convert the value of an object to its string representation and to embed that representation in a string. .NET 提供廣泛的格式化支援，下列格式的主題中的更詳細地說明：.NET provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 如需有關複合格式功能的詳細資訊，請參閱[複合格式化](~/docs/standard/base-types/composite-formatting.md)。For more information about the composite formatting feature, see [Composite Formatting](~/docs/standard/base-types/composite-formatting.md). - 如需有關數值格式規範的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自訂數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 如需有關日期和時間格式規範的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)和[自訂日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md)。For more information about date and time format specifiers, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md) and [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md). - 如需列舉格式規範的詳細資訊，請參閱[列舉格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/enumeration-format-strings.md)。For more information about enumeration format specifiers, see [Enumeration Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/enumeration-format-strings.md). - 如需格式的詳細資訊，請參閱[格式化型別](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about formatting, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). `format`參數是由零個或多個文字執行混合零或多個索引的預留位置，稱為對應格式項目，這個方法的參數清單中的物件。The `format` parameter consists of zero or more runs of text intermixed with zero or more indexed placeholders, called format items, that correspond to an object in the parameter list of this method. 格式化的程序會將每個格式項目取代對應之物件的值的字串表示。The formatting process replaces each format item with the string representation of the value of the corresponding object. 格式項目的語法如下所示：The syntax of a format item is as follows: {*index*[,*length*][:*formatString*]}{*index*[,*length*][:*formatString*]} 方括號中的項目是選擇性的。Elements in square brackets are optional. 下表描述每個項目。The following table describes each element. 如需有關複合格式功能，包括語法的格式項目，請參閱[複合格式化](~/docs/standard/base-types/composite-formatting.md)。For more information about the composite formatting feature, including the syntax of a format item, see [Composite Formatting](~/docs/standard/base-types/composite-formatting.md). |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |索引index|參數清單中要格式化之物件的以零為起始位置。The zero-based position in the parameter list of the object to be formatted. 如果所指定的物件*索引*是`null`，格式項目都會取代。If the object specified by *index* is `null`, the format item is replaced by . 因為這個多載具有單一物件，其參數中列出，值*索引*必須一律為 0。Because this overload has only a single object in its parameter list, the value of *index* must always be 0. 如果在沒有參數*索引*位置就會擲回。If there is no parameter in the *index* position, a is thrown.| |*長度*,*length*|在參數的字串表示的字元數目下限。The minimum number of characters in the string representation of the parameter. 如果是正數，參數是靠右對齊。如果是負數，它是靠左對齊。If positive, the parameter is right-aligned; if negative, it is left-aligned.| |:*formatString*:*formatString*|標準或自訂格式字串格式化的物件所支援。A standard or custom format string that is supported by the object to be formatted. 可能值*formatString*支援的物件的值相同`ToString(string format)`方法。Possible values for *formatString* are the same as the values supported by the object's `ToString(string format)` method. 如果*formatString*未指定，並要格式化的物件會實作介面，`null`傳遞的值為`format`參數做為格式字串。If *formatString* is not specified and the object to be formatted implements the interface, `null` is passed as the value of the `format` parameter that is used as the format string.| 前置和尾端大括號字元，"{"和"}"，所需。The leading and trailing brace characters, "{" and "}", are required. 若要指定在單一常值的大括號字元`format`、 指定兩個前置或尾端大括號字元; 也就是"{{"或"}}"。To specify a single literal brace character in `format`, specify two leading or trailing string. .NET 提供廣泛的格式化支援，下列格式的主題中的更詳細地說明：.NET provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 如需有關複合格式功能的詳細資訊，請參閱[複合格式化](~/docs/standard/base-types/composite-formatting.md)。For more information about the composite formatting feature, see [Composite Formatting](~/docs/standard/base-types/composite-formatting.md). - 如需有關數值格式規範的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自訂數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 如需有關日期和時間格式規範的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)和[自訂日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md)。For more enumeration format specifiers, see [Enumeration Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/enumeration-format-strings.md). - 如需格式的詳細資訊，請參閱[格式化型別](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For zero or more runs of text intermixed with zero or more indexed placeholders, called format items, that correspond to an object in the parameter list of this method. 格式化的程序會將每個格式項目取代對應之物件的值的字串表示。The formatting process replaces each format item with the string representation of the value of the corresponding object. 格式項目的語法如下所示：The syntax of a format item is as follows: of the object to be formatted. 如果所指定的物件*索引*是`null`，格式項目都會取代。If the object specified by *index* is `null`, the format item is replaced by . 因為這個多載具有陣列，其參數中列出，值*索引*永遠必須小於陣列的長度。Because this overload has an array in its parameter list, the value of *index* must always be less than the length of the array. 如果在沒有參數*索引*位置就會擲回。If there is no parameter in the *index* position, a is thrown.| |*長度*,*length*|在參數的字串表示的字元數目下限。The minimum number of characters in the string representation of the parameter. 如果是正數，參數是靠右對齊。如果是負數，它是靠左對齊。If positive, the parameter is right-aligned; if negative, it is left-aligned.| |:*formatString*:*formatString*|標準或自訂格式字串格式化的物件所支援。A standard or custom format string that is supported by the object to be formatted. 可能值*formatString*支援的物件的值相同`ToString(string 前置和尾端大括號字元，"{"和"}"，所需。The leading and trailing brace characters, "{" and "}", are required. 若要指定在單一常值的大括號字元`format`、 指定兩個前置或尾端大括號字元; 也就是"{{"或"}}"。To specify a single literal brace character in `format`, specify two leading or trailing brace characters; that is, "{{" or "}}". 這個方法不會在指定的字串中搜尋個別的新行字元 (十六進位的 0x000a)，也不會以 取代它們。This method does not search the specified string for individual newline characters (hexadecimal 0x000a) and replace them with . 如果格式字串中不會參考指定的物件，則會忽略它。If a specified object is not referenced in the format string, it is ignored. 行結束字元是由 欄位所定義。The line terminator is defined by the field. 如需的一般 I/O 工作清單，請參閱[一般 I/O 工作](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md).
